data.title: Sort on Mod N
data.statement:
Given an input [[sequence]] and a positive integer [[N]], sort those integers in the sequence <<that are divisible by [[N]]>>. The positions of the integers in the list that are not divisible by [[N]] should be unchanged in the output. In other words, the sorted elements need to be shifted around the elements that do not fit the condition.

In more mathematical terms: [[N]] divides into a given integer [[a]] if [[a]] mod [[N]] = 0
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read sequence:string(256)

write sorted sequence mod n
data.inputDescription: A positive integer [[N]], followed by a [[sequence]] of integers.
data.outputDescription: A single sequence where each element mod [[N]] appears in ascending order around the original elements.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given an input sequence and a positive integer N, sort those integers in the sequence that are divisible by N. The positions of the integers in the list that are not divisible by N should be unchanged in the output. In other words, the sorted elements need to be shifted around the elements that do not fit the condition.

In more mathematical terms: N divides into a given integer a if a mod N = 0
Input
A positive integer N, followed by a sequence of integers.
Output
A single sequence where each element mod N appears in ascending order around the original elements.
Constraints
1 <= N <= 1000
Elements in sequence range from -100 to 100
Example
Input
2
9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1
Output
9 2 7 4 5 6 3 8 1
